p: Response surfaces developed for UK catchments show the flood regime to be more sensitive to precipitation than evaporation changes (Prudhomme et al., 2003; Prudhomme, Crooks, et al., 2013; Prudhomme, Kay, et al., 2013). This is also supported by Bastola et al. ( 2011b), who examined flood sensitivity using the SN framework applied to four Irish catchments. They found that changes in PE associated with temperature increases had a negligible effect on flood magnitude. Thus, our assessment is restricted to a single scenario representing an absolute increase in mean annual temperature of 2 °C relative to 1976–2005.
